blocks.name: df-hnorm
blocks.content: Define the function for the norm of a vector of Hilbert space. See ~ normval for its value and ~ normcl for its closure. Theorems ~ norm-i-i , ~ norm-ii-i , and ~ norm-iii-i show it has the expected properties of a norm. In the literature, the norm of ` A ` is usually written "|| ` A ` ||", but we use function notation to take advantage of our existing theorems about functions. Definition of norm in [Beran] p. 96. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-hba
blocks.content: Define base set of Hilbert space, for use if we want to develop Hilbert space independently from the axioms (see comments in ~ ax-hilex ). Note that ` ~H ` is considered a primitive in the Hilbert space axioms below, and we don't use this definition outside of this section. This definition can be proved independently from those axioms as theorem ~ hhba . (Contributed by NM, 31-May-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-h0v
blocks.content: Define the zero vector of Hilbert space. Note that ` 0vec ` is considered a primitive in the Hilbert space axioms below, and we don't use this definition outside of this section. It is proved from the axioms as theorem ~ hh0v . (Contributed by NM, 31-May-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-hvsub
blocks.content: Define vector subtraction. See ~ hvsubvali for its value and ~ hvsubcli for its closure. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: df-hlim
blocks.content: Define the limit relation for Hilbert space. See ~ hlimi for its relational expression. Note that ` f : NN --> ~H ` is an infinite sequence of vectors, i.e. a mapping from integers to vectors. Definition of converge in [Beran] p. 96. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-hlim(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(chli, copab(s0, s1, wa(wa(wf(cv(s0), cn, chba), wcel(cv(s1), chba)), wral(s2, crp, wrex(s3, cn, wral(s4, cfv(cuz, cv(s3)), wbr(cfv(cno, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s4)), cmv, cv(s1))), clt, cv(s2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-hlim(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ⊢ ~~>v = { < s0, s1 > |(((s0 : ℕ → ~H)∧ s1 ∈ ~H)∧ ∀(s2 ∈ ℝ+, ∃(s3 ∈ ℕ, ∀(s4 ∈(ℤ≥ ` s3),(normh `((s0 ` s4)[-h]s1))[<]s2))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: df-hcau
blocks.content: Define the set of Cauchy sequences on a Hilbert space. See ~ hcau for its membership relation. Note that ` f : NN --> ~H ` is an infinite sequence of vectors, i.e. a mapping from integers to vectors. Definition of Cauchy sequence in [Beran] p. 96. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-hcau(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(ccauold, crab(s0, co(chba, cmap, cn), wral(s1, crp, wrex(s2, cn, wral(s3, cfv(cuz, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cno, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmv, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s3)))), clt, cv(s1)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}

blocks.content: The group (addition) operation of Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 31-May-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm h2hva(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cva, cfv(cpv, c0))
  -| wceq(c0, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno))
  -| wcel(c0, cnv)
} = {
  eqtr4i(cva, cfv(cpv, c0), cfv(cpv, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno)))
  3eqtrri(cva, cfv(cpv, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno)), cfv(c1st, cfv(c1st, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno))), cfv(c1st, cop(cva, csm)))
  vafval(cfv(cpv, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno)), cop(cop(cva, csm), cno))
  eqid(cfv(cpv, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno)))
  fveq2i(c1st, cfv(c1st, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno)), cop(cva, csm))
  op1st(cop(cva, csm), cno)
  opex(cva, csm)
  simp3i(wcel(cno, universe), wcel(cva, universe), wcel(csm, universe))
  op1st(cva, csm)
  simp1i(wcel(cva, universe), wcel(csm, universe), wcel(cno, universe))
  simp2i(wcel(csm, universe), wcel(cva, universe), wcel(cno, universe))
  ax-mp(w3a(wcel(cva, universe), wcel(csm, universe), wcel(cno, universe)), wcel(cop(cop(cva, csm), cno), cnv))
  eqeltrri(cop(cop(cva, csm), cno), cnv, c0)
  nvex(cva, csm, cno)
  fveq2i(cpv, c0, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno))
}

  eqeltrri(< < +h, .h >, normh >, cnv, c0)

blocks.name: h2hvs
blocks.content: The vector subtraction operation of Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  nvmfval(hs0, hs1, c0, cfv(cnsb, c0), chba, cva, csm)

  eqid(cfv(cnsb, c0))
